title: IBM Cloud overview docs
introduction: The platform is built to support your needs whether it's working only in the public cloud or taking advantage of a multicloud deployment model. Leverage the docs, API & SDK reference, architecture references, and more to support your app development needs.

section_recommended.title: What's included in the platform?
section_recommended.description: The platform consists of a network of interrelated components that work together to provide a consistent and dependable cloud experience to support your app development needs.

section_recommended.title: Try out IBM Cloud, for free
section_recommended.description: Get up and running quickly by setting up an account and exploring free products with this short tutorial.

section_recommended.title: Service and infrastructure by location
section_recommended.description: Check out the regions and data centers that IBM Cloud products are available.

tiles.title: Limit access with resource attribute-based conditions
tiles.description: You can now create a single IAM policy that grants access based on multiple resource attribute-based conditions.

tiles.title: Moving deployed software into a deployable architecture
tiles.description: Use the IBM Cloud CLI to convert deployed software or an existing Schematics workspace and its resources into a deployable architecture that is compatible with using projects to manage future deployments.

tiles.title: Symantec VIP 2FA is deprecated
tiles.description: If you are currently using Symantec VIP as your external authentication method, you can continue to use it and add subscribers as needed until 26 October 2024. If you are not already using Symantec VIP, then you can't purchase Symantec VIP to use as your external authentication method as of 26 October 2023. All customers currently using Symantec VIP must migrate to IBM Cloud MFA by 26 October 2024.
